section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, this section applies only to a loan made by a credit grantor to a consumer borrower.
This section does not apply to a loan to which § 3-105.1 of the Real Property Article applies.

text.section:
Within a reasonable time after a loan to a consumer borrower has been repaid in full and all other obligations under the agreement, note, or other evidence of the loan have been fulfilled, a credit grantor shall:
Indelibly mark with the word "paid" or "canceled" and return to the consumer borrower each agreement, note, or other evidence of the loan; or
Furnish the consumer borrower with a written statement that identifies the loan transaction and states that the loan has been paid in full; and
Release any recorded mortgage, deed of trust, security agreement, or other lien securing the loan.

The release shall be:
In writing; and
Prepared at the expense of the credit grantor.

section.section: If the credit grantor does not record the release, the credit grantor shall furnish the consumer borrower with the release in a recordable form.
If the credit grantor records the release, the credit grantor shall furnish the consumer borrower with a copy of the release.

If a fee is collected by a credit grantor for the recording of a release:
The release shall be recorded by the credit grantor; and
Any portion of the fee not paid to a governmental entity for recording the release shall be refunded to the borrower.
If a fee is not collected by a credit grantor for the recording of a release, the credit grantor is not obligated to record the release.
